description: Erection of a single storey front extension, hip to gable roof extension, front dormer and 2 x rear roof lights
decision_conditions: The proposed roof extensions by reason of their size, siting and design, would be disproportionate and bulky, failing to read as subordinate to the house and failing to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the West Drayton Green Conservation Area, all contrary to Policies HE1 and BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One Strategic (2012) and Policies DMHB 1, DMHB 4,  DMHB 11 and Policy DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020).

The proposed front extension, by reason of its siting and proximity, would harm the existing living conditions of No.15 Bagley Close, causing a harmful loss of light and outlook, directly contrary to policies DMHB 11 and Policy DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020).

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way. We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies from the  Local Plan Part 1, Local Plan Part 2, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service. We have however been unable to seek solutions to problems arising from the application as the principal of the proposal is clearly contrary to our statutory policies and negotiation could not overcome the reasons for refusal.
